gobblin.metastore

Class FsStateStore<T extends State>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.metastore.FsStateStore<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - state object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateStore<T>

    public class FsStateStore<T extends State>
extends Object
implements StateStore<T>
    An implementation of StateStore backed by a FileSystem.

    This implementation uses Hadoop SequenceFile to store States. Each store maps to one directory, and each table maps to one file under the store directory. Keys are state IDs (see State.getId()), and values are objects of State or any of its extensions. Keys will be empty strings if state IDs are not set (i.e., State.getId() returns null). In this case, the get(String, String, String) method may not work.

      • put

        public void put(String storeName,
                String tableName,
                T state)
         throws IOException
        See StateStore#put(String, String, T).

        This implementation does not support putting the state object into an existing store as append is to be supported by the Hadoop SequenceFile (HADOOP-7139).

        Specified by:
        put in interface StateStore<T extends State>
